video.title: Startalk
video.synopsis: In this entertaining talk show, a popular astrophysicist explores the intersection of science and pop culture with guests, celebrities and comedians.

episodes.synopsis: Former Star Trek cast member George Takei visits StarTalk to discuss important Earth topics like race relations, gender issues and the Cold War.
episodes.title: George Takei

episodes.synopsis: "The Dark Knight" director joins Neil to discuss physics and filmmaking. Plus, Neil recites black hole poetry and Bill Nye tells why Earth is unique.
episodes.title: Christopher Nolan

episodes.synopsis: Sex columnist Dan Savage brings a scientific perspective to the topics of love, gender identity, polyamory, love at first sight and infidelity.
episodes.title: Dan Savage

episodes.synopsis: Huffington Post's co-founder joins host Neil deGrasse Tyson to discuss digital information dissemination, blogging and modern-day journalism.
episodes.title: Arianna Huffington

episodes.synopsis: Evolutionary biologist Richard Dawkins and Rev. James Martin join Neil to compare and contrast science and religion relating to humankind's progress.
episodes.title: Richard Dawkins

episodes.synopsis: U.S. president Jimmy Carter updates Neil on efforts to eradicate Earthly diseases, Chuck learns about leeches, and Bill Nye ponders microscopic foes.
episodes.title: Jimmy Carter

episodes.synopsis: Neil learns from former ISS commander Chris Hadfield how social media relates to space travel; co-host Bill Nye ponders human exploration of space.
episodes.title: Chris Hadfield

episodes.synopsis: Learn how social media has changed news consumption when Neil talks with Twitter co-founder Biz Stone about flocking, flash mobs and celebrity tweets.
episodes.title: Biz Stone

episodes.synopsis: StarTalk welcomes NASA administrator Maj. General Charles Bolden to chat about the Space Shuttle, the Hubble telescope and why we see stars twinkle.
episodes.title: Charles Bolden

episodes.synopsis: Sitcom king Norman Lear takes the guest seat to discuss television's impact on American culture, Isaac Newton, the lunar landing, racism and religion.
episodes.title: Norman Lear
